Description: Gold granulated bead made of two superimposed welded circles of six globules around a central circular hole.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Probably from the desert surface aournd the site.
Curator's comments: One of the gold "pieces of globule work (...) of chains " mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "Gold bead, soldered globules", ibid. p. 110, pl. xli, 17. See the similar item London, BM, EA 18270.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 17)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.83, p.186, pl.28)
